DataElement.preferredName: MicroRNA Probe Annotation Life Sciences Identifier Organizational Unit java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A sequence of single-stranded RNA which is typically 20-25 nucleotides in length and may regulate the expression of other genes. miRNAs are RNA genes which are transcribed from DNA, but are not translated into proteins.:General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.:An explanatory or critical comment that has been added to a text._A unique identifier meant to be a common way to identify and access biologically significant data, whether that data is stored in files, relational databases, in applications, or in internal or public data sources. Every LSID consists of up to five parts: the Network Identifier (NID); the root DNS name of the issuing authority; the namespace chosen by the issuing authority; the object id unique in that namespace; and an optional revision id for storing versioning information. Each part is separated by a colon.:Organizational unit like a laboratory, institute or consortium._Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A sequence of single-stranded RNA which is typically 20-25 nucleotides in length and may regulate the expression of other genes. miRNAs are RNA genes which are transcribed from DNA, but are not translated into proteins.:General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.:An explanatory or critical comment that has been added to a text.

Concepts.definition: A sequence of single-stranded RNA, that is 20-25 nucleotides in length, which is transcribed from DNA but is not translated into a protein. This nucleic acid may regulate the transcription or translation of other genes.

General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.
An explanatory or critical comment, or other in-context information (e.g., pattern, motif, link), that has been associated with data or other types of information.

Property.preferredDefinition: A unique identifier meant to be a common way to identify and access biologically significant data, whether that data is stored in files, relational databases, in applications, or in internal or public data sources. Every LSID consists of up to five parts: the Network Identifier (NID); the root DNS name of the issuing authority; the namespace chosen by the issuing authority; the object id unique in that namespace; and an optional revision id for storing versioning information. Each part is separated by a colon.:Organizational unit like a laboratory, institute or consortium.

Concepts.definition: A unique identifier meant to be a common way to identify and access biologically significant data, whether that data is stored in files, relational databases, in applications, or in internal or public data sources. Every LSID consists of up to five parts: the Network Identifier (NID); the root DNS name of the issuing authority; the namespace chosen by the issuing authority; the object id unique in that namespace; and an optional revision id for storing versioning information. Each part is separated by a colon.
Organizational unit like a laboratory, institute or consortium.
